header.aside: Cinnamon roll + apple pie = an original Lila, Chop! breakfast smoothie recipe for beginners, dedicated to Binbin.

section.p: Two years ago, the week before our bachelors graduation and grad trip to Turkey, I hosted my last Sunday girls' brunch. Unlike my previous brunches where I served home-made Swedish sticky chocolate cake and croissants fresh from a local Swiss bakery, I was determined to throw a healthy brunch party fit for a pre-beach vacation. It was to show off my clean-baking skills and share my fitspiration with my friends, through delicious, healthy food. Binbin was one of the delightful guests who impressed us with her her own culinary skills (it must be a Thai thing). Our mutual successful recipe was oatmeal protein pancakes, which we devoured with cinnamon almond butter and caramelised apples.

tr.td: Blend all ingredients together in a high-speed blender until smooth and creamy.
Pour smoothie into two glasses and garnish with any leftover fresh apple slices and sprinkle with cinnamon.
Mot-gaew, as we say in Thai for cheers... which literally means empty your glass!

section.p: Once again, using frozen fruit is so much better than fresh fruit in smoothies as it gives it a thicker, creamier consistency. No frozen apples available from the grocery store? Simple chop up fresh ones the night before and freeze them in zip-lock bags.
To up the nutritional content of your smoothie, add Greek yoghurt or banana. This makes a fantastic breakfast smoothie, and will keep you comfortably full and going all morning!

section.p: You know how people are crazy about peanut butter? Apparently peanut butter is the fit girl's equivalent to a tub of Ben 'n Jerry's ice cream. Now, although I do love the stuff (yes, both Ben 'n Jerry's and peanut butter), I'm far crazier about almond butter. In fact, as a child I would eat organic peanut butter out of the jar whilst my friends ate ice cream and nutella. I've had my fair share of almond butter sampling, and can confidently say that this one in particular has to be by far the greatest almond butter out there. You Fresh Naturals have an entire line of flavoured almond butters that are to die for. For this recipe, I used cinnamon roll... Mmmm.
